definition: to adjust to a different time zone
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]

sentences.english: Maybe it's jet lag from yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 也许是你昨天倒时差的关系。

sentences.english: Well, you must be tired after a long trip, and you have to get over the jet-lag.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，长途旅行之后您一定很累了，您还得倒时差呢。

sentences.english: Coming back to New York, I was severely jet-lagged.
sentences.chinese: 刚回到纽约那几天，我一直在倒时差。

sentences.english: Well, you must be very tired after the long trip, and you have to get over the jet-lag.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，长途旅行之后您一定很累了，您还得倒时差呢。

definition: to have difficulties sleeping in a bed other than one's own
to stay up late or all night
to get off a plane/to deplane
to go on an official or business trip
